scenes.title: The Corroded Gate
scenes.text: You stand before the park. It does not call to you. It pulls. The air is heavy, thick with a swirling grey smoke that smells of ozone and forgotten time. Beyond the rusted iron gate, the skeletal rides are theorems in a dead equation. Something vast and indifferent waits here. It has waited for a very long time.

choices.text: Walk towards the motionless Ferris Wheel.

scenes.title: House of Giggles
scenes.text: Inside, silence reigns. Your candle flame stretches the shadows of warped mirrors. The reflections are wrong. They show a place that is not here, filled with impossible angles. From the dark, a shape of fractured mannequins and peeling paint lurches. Its joints click with a sound like cracking bone. It is a crude vessel, animated by a will that does not understand anatomy.

scenes.title: The Ferris Wheel
scenes.text: You approach the great wheel. It is a monument to stillness. Ghostly apparitions, like faded photographs of laughing families, flicker inside the passenger cars. They are memories, trapped in a loop. A low, resonant hum emanates from the metal, a vibration you feel in your teeth. It is the slow, sleeping breath of whatever resides here.

scenes.title: The Sweet-Smelling Midway
scenes.text: You stumble out onto the main path. The air is thick with the phantom smell of spun sugar. A being woven from steel cables and matted pink fluff drifts towards you. Its many limbs end in grasping ticket stubs. It is a hungry thought, given form by the park's machinery and the fading dreams of children. It does not see you as a person. It sees you as a component.

scenes.title: The Silent Booth
scenes.text: The small booth is a bubble of silence. A single candle burns on the control panel, its flame impossibly still. A leather-bound journal lies open beside a large, red lever. The journal's pages are not filled with words, but with diagrams of celestial orbits and star-charts that are not of this sky. They map a place that is both infinitely large and small enough to fit in this park.
scenes.image_prompt: A cramped operator's booth. A large, red power lever is on the central console. Beside it, an open journal filled with geometric diagrams is illuminated by a small candle. Your hand is visible, reaching towards the book. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, warm flickering candlelight, dancing shadows, desaturated pastel colors, faded soft hues, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The Grand Carousel
scenes.text: The carousel is the heart. The painted horses are wrong, their smiles too wide, their eyes carved into spirals. In the center, a column of soft, pulsing lavender light hums. It is the core of the thing, its truest self. A question forms in your mind, a whisper without sound. It asks what you are. It asks for a piece of you.

Your hand holds a small candle, its light dwarfed by the central glow. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, warm flickering candlelight, dancing shadows, desaturated pastel colors, faded soft hues, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Offer it a memory of joy.

scenes.title: A Smaller Prison
scenes.text: You run. The gate is behind you. The normal world greets you with its mundane sounds and smells. You are out. But at night, when you look at the stars, you see the patterns from the journal. You understand the bars of a larger cage. You escaped the park, but you can never escape the sky.

scenes.title: The New Geometry
scenes.text: You trace the diagrams in the journal. They are not drawings. They are instructions. Your mind expands to hold them. The park is a crude lens, focusing a consciousness that spans galaxies. It is not angry, or evil. It simply is. And now, so are you. You see everything. The beginning, the end, and the silent, cold spaces in between.

scenes.title: The Unmaking
scenes.text: You pull the lever. Or, you offer your fear. The result is the same. The presence consumes the negative energy and collapses. The hum stops. The lights die. The smoke vanishes. The park is just an empty, broken place. You have erased something ancient. The silence it leaves behind is a wound in the world, a void that you can feel pressing in on you.

scenes.title: The New Custodian
scenes.text: You give it a perfect, sun-drenched memory. The light in the carousel surges, flowing over you like water. The wood and paint and rust become your flesh. The park becomes your body. You are vast now, and patient. Your thoughts are the swirling smoke. Your voice is the hum of the deep machinery. You will wait for the next visitor.
